newsitem.title: GERMANY: Buba's Krupp-U.S. sees euro as threat to dollar.
newsitem.headline: Buba's Krupp-U.S. sees euro as threat to dollar.

text.p: Bundesbank council member Hans-Juergen Krupp said on Tuesday that the United States saw the dominant position of the dollar threatened by the planned European single currency.
Krupp said the introduction of the euro would create a more balanced global exchange rate system, adding that this was in Europe's interests.
"The U.S. sees the hegemony of the dollar threatened by the euro," Krupp said a during a panel discussion. "It is plausible that the U.S. has such fears."
Arguing in favour of a single currency, Krupp said: "We must get away from a situation in which Europe is tossed to and fro" by turbulence in the currency markets which inevitably entails job losses.
The Bundesbank official said the German mark as a reserve currency would constantly be subject to upward pressure.
He also said financial markets appeared to be anticipating a stable euro, since interest rates in Europe had settled at low levels.
